Examples:
Instead of a lemonade stand,a girl who owns a smartphone and enjoys taking snapshots of animals around her town wants to learn about e commerce and sell her photos for extra cash to donate to the SPCA
a Business traveler has accumulated great travel and vacation images that he would like to get published and see his name in print (credit line) to show his kids that he is an  accomplished photographer
a Student with a camera-phone has an idea for an educational project that he would like to receive "feedback" and communication.
In addition to photo auctions, the Gallery and Auction also offers ad revenue to its users--so even if you’re not selling the rights to your image, you’re still earning money.
Informative You Tube Video:http://youtu.be/ZSXzWwNpVg8
  A VALUABLE AND EASY-TO-USE PHOTO APP: PhotoScramble
  PhotoScramble is designed to be easy, intuitive, and directly interfaced to the Picture Gallery. With your help, we can create a thriving worldwide marketplace for amateur photographers, providing a service much-needed in today’s visually competitive world.
  The PhotoScramble app will retail for approximately $4.95 - $9.95 USD. After purchasing and downloading the app, users will have access to editing tools (similar to Instagram) and a direct upload to the online Photo Gallery. When uploading images, users will be able to add titles, descriptions, and their social media information--allowing for the growth of a global community. The users will be able to put up their work for auction, or simply have it up for display and collect ad revenue.
  App.net confirmed there is nothing like it and it is needed in the app market: a way for users to edit, add special effects to, upload, and monetize their photos. There is a clear need for PhotoScramble in the industry, and with the correct funding, it is certain to take off.
  For a quick example, take a girl who owns a smartphone and enjoys taking snapshots of animals around her town. Once she purchases and downloads the PhotoScramble app, she will be able to use it to edit her photos to perfection. PhotoScramble will then let her upload her images to the Picture Gallery. She will choose whether she would like to retain the rights and simply collect ad revenue, or put up the photo for auction and see who is interested in buying it from her. It’s easy, intuitive, and will earn her money.

  WHO ARE WE?
 The SmartPhone Photography MarketPlace and Gallery and PhotoScramble APP are brought to you by the Art Marketing Agency (http://www.visualartsmarketing.com), a pioneer of online art and photo galleries since 2009. The Agency represents top artists and photographers around the world in online galleries to get their work seen by millions.
  Lead by president Tuck Tucker, himself an acknowledged curator, photography and art marketing expert, the people behind this campaign have enough experience under their belts to ensure its successful development. The only thing left to consider is the funds to get this project going--and that is where you come in.
An Agency working- prototype of our Auction Gallery is: www.NewModernMastersAuctions.com
  HOW YOU CAN HELP
  If an app and marketplace where you can earn money (and HELP others do the same thing) using SmartPhone photography sounds good to you, we encourage you to consider pledging any amount. Developing an app and marketplace to be easily accessible to the public is no easy task. There are many steps along the road, but with the experience of producer Art Marketing Agency, a step-by-step plan has been laid out for the allocation of funds. 
Funds will be used to support these three goals:
 Goal #1: Advertising and Branding
  In order to make this project a global platform, we will need to advertise on search engines and in photography print magazines.
Our targets include the following: Bing, Google Adwords, StumbleUpon, Mashable , Yahoo Search Marketing, Tumblr, Twitter Ads, Delicious,  Modern Photography, and Popular Photography.
Goal #2: Search Engine Optimization
  An essential part of promotion is search engine optimization--making sure that users and potential users will be able to find the Gallery easily. This step includes:
  Search Engine Marketing (SEO)
Promotions with Google, Yahoo, Bing

  The expertise of the Art Marketing Agency is also essential for this step of the process.
  Goal #3: Website Design and Maintenance
  This includes the actual development and maintenance of the website and app. These things take some time to set up and all software will be made as user-friendly as possible, which requires plenty of beta testing, redesigning, and maintenance.
REWARDS AND INCENTIVES
  Any amount, no matter how small, is appreciated and goes toward the development of this marketplace. However, pledging an amount equal to or greater than $25 nets you unique rewards with the SmartPhone Picture Gallery system as soon as it is up and running. Be among the first to upload your images--at no additional cost to your pledge--to our Picture Gallery and begin to earn money with them. You will also receive a 11 x 14 custom photo print of your choice from the auction. 
The greater your pledge, the larger the amount (and sizes) of images you will be able to upload for free, as outlined to the right. 
Depending on the amount pledged, you will also be able to choose photo print(s) of greater size and quality.
  For businesses, we offer the opportunity to exhibit business images and advertisements (such as logos, product imagery, or promotional materials) on our soon-to-be global platform. Pledging an amount equal to or over $250 will net you this benefit, allowing your business worldwide PR and advertising benefits-24/7.
  Large pledges are considered priority investments and will ensure your inclusion in the development of this marketplace innovation, as well as the aforementioned incentives. You will also receive investment details and business development opportunities regarding our POD (Print On Demand) service. 
POD is what we use to print (and deliver by mail) images for the photographers to viewers for a 40 % commission--essentially, you will have a chance to earn royalties along with us.
Even if you cannot pledge an amount at this time, we encourage you to spread the word--share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and anywhere else you feel inclined. The SmartPhone Photography MarketPlace and Gallery is an innovative, much-needed feature of smartphone photography platform and an excellent source of income and exposure for camera-phone photographers and our Supporters.
Be part of the BIG Picture- help us to benefit millions

story:
Introducing the MakerTablet, 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB 


  • Designed for Makers and Kiosks 
  • The only tablet with 'Customized Kiosk Settings' including the ability to remove navigation buttons, autostart an app or webpage, password protect settings, power on when plugged in, stay on while plugged in, and remote management.  Makertablet Manager will be open sourced.
  • Android 4.42 KitKat [CyanogenMod 11] 
  • Kiosk/Ardiuno Hardware Control open source templates available on GitHub. 
  • Instructables as well. Guaranteed to be compatible with Arduino Uno boards



The Idea

Hi, I'm Kevin a software developer and founder of Tonkworks. I found the cost of touch screens for maker projects is way to high so I started hacking away at android tablets to make it easier to interact with all the stuff I end up making (robots, a thermostat, etc).  As the hardware parts for tablets become cheaper and cheaper- It makes more and more sense to use them as dedicated touchscreens for projects.


The Goal

This campaign's goal is to get MakerTablets to as many developers as possible. This way the platform can be improved and a developer community can take shape to build on this platform.



Help make things Interactive!

Shipping is free in the U.S!
A $10 international shipping fee applies.



Risks and Challenges:

We plan to open source the templates for the Restaurant Menu, Paypal store kiosk, Motor control and Thermostat - but we will need a community to help answer questions and build on the platform to make it better.

Forming a developer community around the MakerTablet will likely be the most difficult part of this campaign.

story:
Minuum is now available!

Get it for Android here:



Developer or wearable device hacker? Send us an email at info@minuum.com to inquire about our development kit!

Media coverage:

TechCrunch: Minuum Turns To Indiegogo To Fund A New Mobile Software Keyboard For Smartphones And Beyond 

MobileSyrup: Minuum promises next-gen typing on your smartphone, tablet and just about anything else you can interact with 

Android Police: Minuum Is An Insane Keyboard Replacement On Indiegogo That Squishes Down To One Row, Can Run On Anything

Huffington Post: Minuum Keyboard: Has This Just Solved Touchscreen Typing Forever?

Mashable: Try 'Sloppy Typing' on This Reimagined QWERTY Keyboard 

CNET: Could Minuum finally evolve the virtual QWERTY keyboard? 

CBC: Toronto startup rethinks the way you type 

... and that's just some of it!

 

Your Typing Solution

The Minuum keyboard, through its simplicity, improves your touchscreen typing. Existing keyboards leave you barely enough screen to interact with your apps, and you can’t enjoy typing on them. Minuum eliminates the visual clutter of archaic mobile keyboards by adapting the keyboard to a single dimension. What enables this minimalism is our specialized auto-correction algorithm that allows highly imprecise typing. Your typing on mobile devices is inherently imprecise—and there’s nothing wrong with that. We work with that. By reducing the keyboard to a single dimension, Minuum opens up your touchscreen space for a variety of interaction possibilities—which allows for precision-entry.

Features at a Glance

Minuum improves mobile typing by:

  • Recovering more than half of the usable touchscreen space you lose when you type on traditional virtual keyboards
  • Allowing you fast text entry when your typing is sloppy
  • Providing you with letter magnification for precise typing—especially useful if you have large fingers
  • Giving you the benefit of smart auto-correction
  • Respecting your familiarity with the QWERTY keyboard so you don’t have to re-learn the keyboard layout
  • Providing convenient access to everything you’d expect in a keyboard (such as, punctuation, space, backspace, and enter) without stealing your screen space
  • Letting you type anywhere—with a keyboard you can move around your touchscreen

You will be able to customize the Minuum production release, with options such as: alternate colour schemes to match your smartphone case, curving keyboard layout for more ergonomic text entry, and the ability to rearrange the alphabet to your liking.

International Languages

Minuum is extensible beyond the 26 characters of the English alphabet and can accommodate any language based on the Latin alphabet, plus punctuation, numbering, symbols, emoticons, or other inputs.

Wearable Typing (and Prototyping) Is Here

The Minuum layout is simply a continuum of letters, laid out in a row. We call it “one-dimensional” because it’s based on one row of keys. This frees up the keyboard to be anywhere you like on the screen, or even to curve for a more ergonomic keyboard shape. This arrangement also means you can type without needing complex sensors or flat surfaces, which means we can do away with large physical keyboards or touchscreens completely. If there is a place where you can measure one dimension of user input, Minuum will let you type there. This means being able to type practically anywhere, including with wearable technology.

Going Beyond Your Touchscreen

The simplest way to migrate Minuum from touchscreens and onto an edge, surface, or object is with a flexible resistive touch strip. You could then make a keyboard using common household supplies like graphite (from pencils), or sew the strip into fabric using conductive thread. As long as you can measure how far along the strip you are touching, Minuum will let you type fast and accurately without your needing to aim for letters precisely.

In fact, with Minuum you can even type without any surface at all, simply by measuring the orientation of your hand gestures in the air. You can do this in several ways, such as:

  • With an accelerometer/gyroscope in a ring, watch, armband, or handheld device
  • With a camera capturing the hand from something like a Kinect, Leap Motion Controller, or Google glasses.

With only one dimension to measure, these kinds of typing systems are easy to make—and easy to use, even in noisy and constrained sensing environments.

Extensibility

You can incorporate Minuum into existing categories of devices to let people type anywhere. For example:

  • Watches—A simple infrared or laser setup built into a watch, which measures where a someone’s finger breaks the beam, can allow wearers to type on their arms.
  • Game controllers—These are notoriously painful to type with. You can use an analog stick to quickly type an e-mail using the Minuum layout, without needing to be precise.

We have been prototyping and developing each of these Minuum applications mentioned above. If you are a developer of wearable tech devices, we'd love to hear from you about how you'd like people to type with your device.

Use Cases

Accessibility

Minuum is accessible and, in different forms, can adapt to your typing needs. However tech-savvy you are, Minuum’s touchscreen keyboard can meet your text-entry style. Users with disabilities mark one end of the continuum, and we will be testing our technology on applications that allow us to serve them.

Platform Support

Google Android currently provides the most popular ecosystem that allows alternative virtual keyboards, so we will initially develop Minuum for availability to you through the Google Play Store.

Since Apple’s restrictions on iOS do not allow you to replace the default keyboard, we will make a Minuum version for iOS app developers to include in their software. Check out our developer support.

We can also help others put who want to put Minuum on touchscreen devices using other operating systems (for example, Windows Phone, BlackBerry). Interested? Let us know.

iOS Developer Library

You made your app look appealing. Why let the keyboard get in the way of that? We welcome iOS application developers implementing Minuum as their go-to typing method. Minuum is an ideal option wherever you show a lot of information or type a lot of text.

To help you develop Minuum-enabled apps, we will produce an iOS developer library, which you can license.

Contact us about licensing the Minuum iOS SDK to get started. If you want your keyboard to fit the look-and-feel of your app, let us know!

Progress So Far

We have prototyped a Minuum app for iOS and have pivoted to developing an Android app. (See Platform Support, above, and Apple’s iOS app restrictions.) Right now we have a working prototype of the Android app.

Development Roadmap

Near-term projects include:

  • Android touchscreen Minuum keyboard beta release to our crowdfunding supporters two months after the end of our campaign
  • General Android Minuum keyboard beta release—prioritizing feature requests from our supporters—in Q1, 2014
  • Demo app and SDK for iOS in Q1, 2014

As you can see, by supporting us you get access to our beta release at least two months before everyone else.

Wearable Development Kit

If we’re funded, you’ll be able to use an open Minuum wearable development kit (WDK) in about a year’s time. This will allow anyone—even non-specialists—to incorporate typing into everyday things. The Minuum project involves applying our virtual keyboard algorithms to other typing needs beyond touchscreens. Soon, you’ll be able to type quickly and accurately using a variety of wearable devices. Many of these haven’t been imagined yet, and our WDK will help you build those devices you dream of. Want to create a sweater that types or put a keyboard in your iPhone case? Using our WDK you’ll be able to connect to Android, iOS, Mac, or windows platforms and send the text you want.

Timeline for the Minuum Project

 

 

The Ask: How You Can Help

If a future with wearable computing, as enabled by the Minuum project’s one-dimensional keyboard, looks astounding to you, it is. You can help us bring that future closer. We’ve received some seed funding through the UTEST program and from MaRS Innovation, but we need your help.

We have a software developer we’d like to hire to produce the beta version on Minuum for Android—working under our guidance. We’re seeking $10,000 to help complete this development of a fully functional Android Minuum. That’s our campaign goal. We’re asking you to help us accomplish this.

Bonus

Beyond producing an Android Minuum beta, an additional $50,000 would help us produce an open wearable development kit (WDK) so we can enable you to start prototyping wearable typing devices. That’s our stretch goal. By helping us advance the Minuum project, you not only get our heartfelt thanks but also the satisfaction of championing some far-reaching technology—which is pretty cool.

Backstory

Minuum was inspired by a U of T research project: invent a better way of typing on touchscreen mobile phones without looking. This encouraged us to investigate various device-tilting techniques relying on user motion—which we understood to be useful in the field of wearable technology. The Minuum virtual keyboard for touchscreens is simply one extension of this approach. As a result of our research, we took the following steps to bring the technology to life:

  • Designed a new alphabet layout
  • Developed the disambiguation algorithm
  • Ran user studies with various device-tilting techniques, finding that people could type at up to 37 words per minute, using carefully designed audio feedback, without any visual feedback or looking at their phones

User motion, though imprecise, allowed us to type amazingly well. Since we realized our technology had uses beyond this cool new rotational text entry method, we pivoted to focus on creating a better touchscreen keypad. We founded Whirlscape to make this happen. All along we’ve been looking ahead to a new wave of typing with wearable technology. What we’ve created so far is much cooler than what we originally set out to do. We received some support for the Minuum project from UTEST program and MaRS Innovation and now we need your help to take it even further.

Technology Team

Will Walmsley, CEO of Whirlscape, lead designer

  • M.A.Sc., University of Toronto, 2012, Human Factors Engineering
  • Honours B.Sc. (Eng.), Queen's University, 2010, Engineering Physics

Walmsley has invented a diverse range of interaction techniques ranging from bendable mobile phones to novel 3D surgical displays to revolutionary methods of mobile typing. He has a passion for human-computer interaction (HCI) and simplifying technology.

Learn more about Will Walmsley on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/will-walmsley/9/a7/268

 

Khai N. Truong, vice-president of Whirlscape

  • Associate Professor, University of Toronto, Bahen Centre for Information Technology.

Truong’s research interests are in HCI and ubiquitous computing (Ubicomp). His focus is on enhancing usability and usefulness within the scope of mobile computing experiences. This involves investigating:

  • Tools and methods to support the development of novel ubiquitous computing systems
  • Techniques and models to facilitate user interactions with off-the-desktop computing devices and services

Learn more about Khai N. Truong at: http://khaitruong.com/index.phtml

 

Xavier Snelgrove, computer scientist, researcher

  • M.Sc. (pending), University of Toronto, expected graduation May 2013, Computer Science
  • B.A.Sc. (EngSci), University of Toronto, 2010, Computer and Electrical Engineering

Snelgrove is a generalist with strong industry experience in developing production applications, and research experience in:

  • HCI
  • Computer graphics
  • Computational photography
  • Computer vision

His specialties include graphics programming, multi-lingual development—from Python and Javascript down through C to assembly, full-stack Web-apps, iOS apps, and Android apps.

Learn more about Xavier Snelgrove on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/xavier-snelgrove/36/2a0/89a

 

Connect With Us

Connect and keep up with Whirlscape's simplified mobile interaction technology:

  • www.minuum.com, especially the blog
  • http://twitter.com/minuum, Twitter handle:@minuum
  • http://facebook.com/minuum

We'll update you on developments in the Minuum project and our funding campaign progress. Thanks!

http://facebook.com/minuum
We'll update you on developments in the Minuum project and our funding campaign progress. Thanks!

story:
- - - Important Updates - - - 

Funding: Fri, July 18 - Shuffle secured development capital from a private investor. Of the $35,000 needed to complete the final phase for iOS we now only need $13,000 and have adjusted our Indiegogo goal accordingly.

Perks: Mon, July 21 - We've added the following new perks: "FAMILY PRIVACY", "BASIC PROMO PKG" and "PREMIUM PROMO PKG".

Shuffle featured in the Indiegogo Newsletter! View it here >

- - - 

Hi Indiegogo fans, I'm Craig!... an entrepreneur with a passion for ‘smart’ mobile communication solutions and personal privacy in technology. 

The limited functionality for flexible private communication inspired me to create a solution where users have control over how they connect with the world.

Violation of personal privacy is affecting everyone, each in different ways. From Heartbleed to email harvesting to whatever revelation comes out of Wikileaks next, it's common sense to start taking our personal privacy seriously.

That’s where Shuffle’s smart communication solution comes in.

A layer of privacy for your mobile phone

Click here to view screenshots of Shuffle for iOS >


You can create multiple Shuffle numbers to manage various social or business needs and situations. Calls, texts and voicemails are grouped by Shuffle number to keep your communications separated.

Each Shuffle number comes with its own voice mailbox and personalized voicemail message using voice recording or text to speech functionality.

Your Shuffle numbers are reserved for 30 days at a time, at which point it will either auto-renew or expire, depending on your preference settings. You can also delete a Shuffle at any time before the term expires if you no longer need it.

You can receive and manage voice calls within the app, with the option to ring first or go directly to voicemail. Calls are charged directly from your account balance, but all your Shuffle-to-Shuffle calls are always free.

Text messages are grouped by Shuffle number. It’s easy to search your message history to pick up a previous conversation, or find old messages. Messages are charged against your account balance, but all your Shuffle-to-Shuffle texts are always free.

Shuffle email addresses forward to your regular email address so you don’t need to expose your actual email when posting online.
e.g. Q1X7@shuffle.email forwards messages to you@domain.com

You can have 3 free active Shuffle forwarding emails. Thereafter you are billed against your account balance.

We've thought a LOT about real-world applications for Shuffle. The truth is, there are an endless amount, and we fully expect to see more in the future - which we’ll include in our app. But here are a few things you might find Shuffle useful for today:

Shuffle offers flexibility to users so you’re not locked into a specific plan. Users are able to scale numbers and emails up and down to fit their needs over time by using our flexible, transparent pricing model.

With Shuffle, you can apply your account balance to voice calls or text messages for any Shuffle number in your account as well as for your email forwarding aliases.

Shuffle is also the first and only privacy app to offer users a disposable email forwarding address alongside their disposable numbers!

Shuffle’s pricing model is completely transparent and very affordable. We don’t believe in the 'credits' model that disguises actual costs to users. 

You’ll know exactly what your Shuffle number costs per month, how much you pay for calls per minute, and the cost of each text message. There are NO hidden fees!

So far on the project, we've gotten through the branding, design, marketing video and a LARGE chunk of mobile development for the iOS app. With your help we can wrap up development and testing so we can launch iOS to the public by October this year.

Here’s a breakdown of what has been accomplished so far...

To get this far, so we could show supporters a real business they’re backing, I've funded Shuffle out of my own pocket. All we have left is to wrap up the final integration and testing of iOS to release Shuffle in the App Store.

To complete this final stage of iOS we need US$13,000 to push the project over the goal line and bring Shuffle to life.

We need you! Please support our campaign and claim some of the awesome perks we're offering exclusively to our project backers.

We've already started with the Android UI design. Development will commence once iOS is launched, all kinks are ironed out, and Shuffle starts gaining some traction.

If all goes according to plan we’ll launch Shuffle for Android on the Google Play Store early in 2015. 

All funds raised over and above our goal will be allocated towards the Android development budget. All contributors will have lifetime Shuffle bragging rights for iOS and Android.

We've put together the following perks so you can help us create Shuffle and be part of taking flexible ‘smart’ communication and privacy protection to the next level:

OR, click here to support our ThunderClap! campaign by clicking on the Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr buttons to help spread the Shuffle love.



Thank you for supporting Shuffle! With your help we can create 'smart' communication solutions so everyone can connect privately.

The success of Shuffle will affect people worldwide in many different ways, and ultimately make everyday communication a safer and more pleasant experience.

We wouldn't be able to do it without your backing - you’re awesome! :) 


Shuffle Ventures, Inc.

Web: http://getshuffle.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetShuffleApp
Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetShuffleApp
Founder & CEO: Craig Collett


The Phuse, Inc.

Web: http://thephuse.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thephuse
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thephuse
Founder & Creative Director: James Costa


CabForward, Inc.

Web: http://www.cabforward.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/CabForward
Founder & CEO: Lance Vaughn

story:
Creating a fully colored 3D model by simply scanning an object with an iPhone was an amazing experience, one of those moments that really grounds you in the reality of how far technology has come, but in that same vein, it can also always be improved.

We found that, in order to get the highest quality complex and detailed scans that we could, it was pertinent that we use the FaceID feature of the iPhone while scanning. However, having to use the front of the phone means holding the device at uncomfortable angles, and because we cannot see the screen getting a proper scan is very difficult. 

Introducing the ScanMira

 We created the ScanMira! A simple iPhone and iPad compatible accessory for making it easier to get amazing scans using the FaceID feature.

How to Use:

  • Slide the ScanMira onto your iPhone or iPad 
  • Open your favorite 3D Scanning App 
  • Scan with ease! 
 
ScanMira:
 

Simply watch the screen while you scan to avoid missing sections and to ensure you capture every angle of your object for the perfect scan.

Scanning without VS with ScanMira

Scanning without seeing the screen of your phone can leave holes in your scans, meaning multiple tries are needed to get the perfect scan, but with ScanMira you can get the perfect scan before your eyes.

We wanted to make sure that scanning with the ScanMira would have no negative effects on your scans, so we opted to use a First Surface Mirror, which reflects clearer images than the average mirror you can get at the store.

Compatible Devices

 Recommended Scanning Apps:

We recommend EM3D as a 3D scanning app. Please download it from the App Store on your compatible iPhone or iPad!

With or without a case you can easily make 3D scans with any of the listed Apple Products! Scan and share with your friends as simple as sending a text.  

Join the VR, AR, or 3D Printing revolution. With 3D scanning, you can make Snapchat Lenses, Create AR pictures, or even use a 3D Printer to make physical 3D copies of your favorite objects.

 

The Full Scanning Process:

 

Scanning Results:

Check out some of our very own scans! 

 

Check out more of our scans in 3D on SketchFab: 

Our SketchFab

 

 

Below are the different items included in the different rewards! You can see the rewards they appear in listed above the image.

 

Turntable: 

The turntable comes with a wall plug, a wireless remote. The turntable comes with a variety of speeds and settings, as explained below.

This is included in the rewards titled: "ScanMira + Turntable" and "The Complete Set"

 See all the ways it can turn! 

Phone Stand:

This is included in the rewards titled: "ScanMira + Stand" and "The Complete Set"

 

** Please Note The Stand Cannot Hold iPad Sized Devices**

The Phone Stand is easy to adjust to whatever position you need. The head is spring-loaded to ensure a firm grasp for your iPhone, the height can be raised or lowered and locked into place and the same goes for the angle of the arm, and the legs that hold the stand up can be turned 360 degrees for easy storage. 

Tracking Pyramids:

It's easy to lose track during scanning. For example, a coffee cup on a table will be seen from most viewing angles as a cylindrical object on a flat surface. In this case, it's very difficult to track the location and orientation with your iPhone.

These pyramids will be included at ALL rewards levels!

We created these tracking pyramids (set of 6) to help with tracking. They will make scanning MUCH easier!

story:
***NOTE: We didn't write in the description but for the $55 combo deal add $10 for international shipping.  


What Is The LVO Backpack?

The LVO backpack is a vision of mine which combines style with functionality and affordability.  I was disappointed with the options I had when searching for backpacks for either work or school.  I wanted to make sure the LVO backpack design had a minimalist look yet provided all the necessary features.  Overall I wanted this new line of backpacks to consist of three important aspects: 

  • Functionality
  • Quality
  • Style

What sets us apart?

  • What makes LVO backpacks different is that our backpacks have a simplistic look with more modern features which make carrying around your belongings more enjoyable and effortless. We do this by adding features to make our backpack more convenient for the owner. The cell phone/iPod pouch that is connected to your headphone allows you to travel while listening to music without any problems. The LVO backpack also has a very well organized main pocket. We have divided the main pocket by adding a fully padded laptop pouch which will protect your most important valuables from normal day to day damage that our competitors' backpacks might allow.

  • The LVO backpack also makes listening to your music on the go so much easier and hands free.  There is a headphone jack which connects from a cellphone pouch to a back pocket. This'll allow the use of any style headphones along with storage for extra cords (which can often get in the way).

  • While the LVO backpack consists of many new and special features we've still kept the classic features everyone loves. Such as we made sure this backpack had a water bottle pouch. No one ever likes having their water bottles inside their backpacks with all their papers and important belongings. There have been countless times where people have had a water bottle that leaked and ruined something in their backpacks. So we eliminated that problem with a simple solution of adding a separate water bottle pouch.

  •  The front pouch provides storage space for pens, keys and other belongings you may have. This front pouch is for all those miscellaneous items that you'll need easy access to throughout your day. With our front pouch we added a mesh side with elastic to hold your items tightly.  On the other side, we have a canvas material with elastic to help organize all those loose pens you'll have in your other backpacks.   
Quality: 

The LVO backpack is made from strong military grade canvas, complimented with leather-like trim.  This backpack is hand made to insure the quality and durability of the stitching.  We also use a more robust zipper design to allow the user to open and close each pocket with ease. With the amount of effort we put into the quality of our products, we guarantee they will last longer than the other brands available in the market place today.


Style:

Style was the most important component we considered when designing the LVO backpack.  We wanted a product which looked good in any setting. These backpacks will be a fashion statement at school, work, traveling, ect.  These are the four color combinations we have created, they'll be able to match with any outfit and will have you walking around with confidence and swag. We will be starting with these four colors, as we receive feedback during the campaign, more color combinations will be made available.

Design & Production

When first creating the LVO backpack we started with a simple hand drawn design. This snowballed into a complete backpack after a lot of trial and error. We came up with our design by basing our backpack off different features we considered stylish on the backpacks we liked. With the style part down, we studied different backpacks and which features we felt were necessary and which features were just a waste of space. This helped us design a backpack that is very user friendly. With a very practical design on paper, we then met with a sewing company in San Diego, California. After many meetings and altering our design we finally came up with our prototype. We ran a few test trials by using the backpack in normal situations. We gathered notes on which features needed improving. Now the final product of the LVO backpack is done and with your help we'll be able to get the most practical and biggest bang for your buck for a backpack on the market.

 Dimensions: 

The Backpack: 16.5" x 14" x 4.5"

The Front pocket: 8"x 6" x 1"

The Laptop pouch: 15" x 11" x 1.5"

How the money raised will be used:

Your support will be going towards the first production run of the LVO backpacks.  We have set a campaign goal of $2,500 in order to meet our manufactures' minimum order requirements, shipping costs, taxes, fees, and any miscellaneous costs. This will be necessary because this company started in a friends garage where we drew up a design and started sewing our first prototype (which didn't come out well at all). We then branched out to a manufacturer in San Diego, California, who helped us create the two prototypes that are shown in the videos and pictures. We believe with the help we'll get from everyone here on Indeigogo that we can build the LVO brand name into more than just a garage start up company.

Who is the team and how did it all start?

Started by young entrepreneurs, fashion, and backpack enthusiasts, Alex and Danny sought to cut out the hassle of trying to choose a backpack which had either style OR had functionality. We have been big on fashion and backpacks our entire life and got fed up paying for overpriced name brand backpacks that did not fit our needs. So now we are doing it ourselves.  We started as friends, became roommates, and are now hoping to become business partners.

story:
Introduction:

Hi, my name is Steve Tuthill.  I am overseeing the development of TapURit; and I have been involved in software development for many years.  I find that mobile media is both exciting to develop and fun to use.  The notion of sharing fun times, thoughts, and opinions is more convenient than in the past and immediate as well. 

A few of us were planning a party – thus the comments in the movie – and were looking for an easy way to send invitations, provide maps, and have an event recap that we could easily send to our friends.  It seemed that we needed to use more than one application to complete the tasks.  There had to be a better way.

I value innovation in my software designs and projects.  From ease of use, to interesting interfaces, to actually being practical TapURit is an app that most everyone can find a use.  Thank you for checking us out in this venue; and I hope you will join us to enable the successful creation of TapURit.

 

We are looking for $40,000 for the TapURit application development costs.

 

Overview:

TapURit is a template-based multimedia application for invitations, event recaps, and announcements, using Navatars, sounds, and easy sharing among groups and across platforms.

TapURit is an easy to use drag and drop app that enables users to enter text, photos, sounds, and movies in a variety of templates. 

Outputs from the application are easily shared on social media sites as well as proximity sharing with friends.

 

The Story:

Whether planning a large party, sending graduation announcements, or determining interest for an event, there are limited choices that are fun to use, easy to learn, easy to share, and have all-encompassing functions for a range of interests.  So, we set out to build something with a unique interface with sound effects when the system sends or receives Taps.  The more we looked into the possibilities, the more excited we became for the opportunity.  As a result, we created the little movie using characters that illustrate what we are intending to move from prototype to products. 

 

The Specs:

  • Work cross platform for iPad, iPhone, and Android devices
  • Enable templates for a variety of uses – invitations, recaps, notices and others
  • Upload text, images, audio, and video
  • Distribute output with email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, blogs, etc.
  • Proximity sharing made easy
  • Create a variety of Navatars, sounds, and templates
  • Focus on functionality

 

Navatars:

Navatars are our navigational avatars.  Each has its own personality.  Each has its own music and characteristics unique to navigational systems to date.  They are usually cooperative to what you ask them to do, but perhaps, sometimes not. 

 

Demo Link

http://youtu.be/UFv-ko6-wCw

 

Your Help:

Even though the app is prototyped, the music needs to be finished, and while the essential development has been done but there are still a few things we need to accomplish before we can call this a finished product. Your funding will help us complete the software development, polish the visuals, create more templates, create more Navatars, create more sound effects, and complete the last programming tasks of cross platform, social networks compatibility, and proximity sharing.

 

The Impact

TapURit is an innovative, fun, easy to use way to create invitations, events, social exchanges and notices using templates, images, audio, and video.  With this application you can connect with your friends individually or in groups.

The development team has extensive experience in software development including apps.  Even more importantly, we really want to use this ourselves!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please reach out to your friends and tell them about TapURit.  We appreciate any help you can provide to make this app available to everyone interested.  Be sure to use the Indegogo share tools.  Thank you.

If you cannot contribute, please reach out to your friends and tell them about TapURit.  We appreciate any help you can provide to make this app available to everyone interested.  Be sure to use the Indegogo share tools.  Thank you.
story_txt:
Introduction:
Hi, my name is Steve Tuthill.  I am overseeing the development of TapURit; and I have been involved in software development for many years.  I find that mobile media is both exciting to develop and fun to use.  The notion of sharing fun times, thoughts, and opinions is more convenient than in the past and immediate as well. 
A few of us were planning a party – thus the comments in the movie – and were looking for an easy way to send invitations, provide maps, and have an event recap that we could easily send to our friends.  It seemed that we needed to use more than one application to complete the tasks.  There had to be a better way.
I value innovation in my software designs and projects.  From ease of use, to interesting interfaces, to actually being practical TapURit is an app that most everyone can find a use.  Thank you for checking us out in this venue; and I hope you will join us to enable the successful creation of TapURit.
 
We are looking for $40,000 for the TapURit application development costs.
 
Overview:
TapURit is a template-based multimedia application for invitations, event recaps, and announcements, using Navatars, sounds, and easy sharing among groups and across platforms.
TapURit is an easy to use drag and drop app that enables users to enter text, photos, sounds, and movies in a variety of templates. 
Outputs from the application are easily shared on social media sites as well as proximity sharing with friends.
 
The Story: 
Whether planning a large party, sending graduation announcements, or determining interest for an event, there are limited choices that are fun to use, easy to learn, easy to share, and have all-encompassing functions for a range of interests.  So, we set out to build something with a unique interface with sound effects when the system sends or receives Taps.  The more we looked into the possibilities, the more excited we became for the opportunity.  As a result, we created the little movie using characters that illustrate what we are intending to move from prototype to products. 
 
The Specs:

Work cross platform for iPad, iPhone, and Android devices
Enable templates for a variety of uses – invitations, recaps, notices and others
Upload text, images, audio, and video
Distribute output with email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, blogs, etc.
Proximity sharing made easy
Create a variety of Navatars, sounds, and templates
Focus on functionality

 
Navatars:
Navatars are our navigational avatars.  Each has its own personality.  Each has its own music and characteristics unique to navigational systems to date.  They are usually cooperative to what you ask them to do, but perhaps, sometimes not. 
 
Demo Link
http://youtu.be/UFv-ko6-wCw
 
Your Help:
Even though the app is prototyped, the music needs to be finished, and while the essential development has been done but there are still a few things we need to accomplish before we can call this a finished product. Your funding will help us complete the software development, polish the visuals, create more templates, create more Navatars, create more sound effects, and complete the last programming tasks of cross platform, social networks compatibility, and proximity sharing.
 

The Impact 
TapURit is an innovative, fun, easy to use way to create invitations, events, social exchanges and notices using templates, images, audio, and video.  With this application you can connect with your friends individually or in groups.
The development team has extensive experience in software development including apps.  Even more importantly, we really want to use this ourselves!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute, please reach out to your friends and tell them about TapURit.  We appreciate any help you can provide to make this app available to everyone interested.  Be sure to use the Indegogo share tools.  Thank you.
If you cannot contribute, please reach out to your friends and tell them about TapURit.  We appreciate any help you can provide to make this app available to everyone interested.  Be sure to use the Indegogo share tools.  Thank you.

story:
The Rapide Lite 200XL - Desktop Plus

Meet Rapide Lite 200XL - the world's first commercial quality 400mm desktop 3D Printer, brought to you by Rapide 3D, the team that created the original Rapide Lite 200 with X Wing Technology.

Rapide Lite 200XL – What The Experts And Users Are Saying:

Rapide Lite 200XL is compatible with Mac, PC and Linux and uses free to own open source software. Rapide Lite 200XL will be built from a block of solid aircraft grade aluminum and feature industry leading technology like an ARM 32 bit control board, a 2.8” LCD touch screen interface and a 214 x 214mm Aluminum Heated Bed.

Rapide Lite 200XL is a power house of printer precision with USB connection or stand alone SD Card printing (4GB SD Card included).
The Build Size – a massive 16,000cm3, allowing you to print objects up to 400mm tall right on your desktop!

The Build Platform – Aluminum Heated Bed made from 3mm machined aluminum PCB (214 x 214mm). Optional Bolsitate Glass bed.

The Control Board – ARM 32 bit technology that allows you to print beyond your wildest imagination.

The Control Interface – 2.8” Full Color LCD Touch Screen control interface which allows complete stand alone printing at the touch of the screen.

The Resolution – our very own Q Extruder matched to our X Wing Technology that delivers up to 50 micron resolution and speeds of up to 150mm per second!*

Simply put, Rapide Lite 200XL - Desktop Plus is the new standard for commercial quality desktop printing and offers an industry leading 400mm of build height.

Why the Rapide Lite 200XL...

Rapide Lite 200XL - Desktop Plus is a must-have for any 3D Printer user who requires build heights that other printers cannot offer on the desktop. The design suits office, home or school and it's small foot print (367mm x 367mm) makes it perfect for the desktop.

How the Rapide Lite 200XL works...

Rapide Lite 200XL - Desktop Plus is an FDM 3D Printer that has been designed to work with all open source 3D Printer software and is compatible with Mac, PC and Linux. Ideal if you want a desktop 3D Printer that is lightweight, fully featured and offers a large build height. Simple, practical, beautiful.

For high-quality performance, Rapide Lite 200XL has a ARM 32 bit control board.

Compatibility...

• Mac, PC and Linux.
• All open source software.
• SD Card Stand Alone or USB connected.
• ABS, PLA, PVA, HIPPS, Nylon, PVC, Laywood. 

Our Perks...

A summary of our perks is listed below. For more information, please refer to the perks on the right-hand side of our page.

$29
Nozzle Me
.3, .4 and .5 Nozzles + Nozzle Removal Tool
$49
Cradle Me
Custom Material Cradle to hold 1 x 1kg Spool
$129
V3 Q Extruder Upgrade
Third Generation Single Extruder Upgrade (factory upgrade only)
$250
V3 Q Extruder
Third Generation Extruder 
$299
X Wing Slider Upgrade
X Wing Slider Upgrade (factory upgrade only)
$1199
Early Bird - Rapide Lite 200XL
Rapide Lite 200XL + ARM 32 Bit Control Board + 2.8” Touch Screen + 2 x 300g PLA + Cradle Me + Shipping (via air)
$1399
Rapide Lite 200XL - Pre Retail
Rapide Lite 200XL + ARM 32 Bit Control Board + 2.8” Touch Screen + 2 x 300g PLA + Cradle Me + Shipping (via air)
$2999
Rapide 3D Experience
Limited Edition Rapide Lite 200XL + 2 days Training at the Factory + 2 nights accommodation and meals provided. Air Fares Not Included.
$3999
Rapide Lite 350
Rapide Lite 350 + ARM 32 Bit Control Board + 3.5” Touch Screen + Dual Extruder + 2 x 300g PLA + 2 x Cradle Me + Shipping (via sea)
$8999
Rapide Lite 500
Rapide Lite 500 + ARM 32 Bit Control Board + 3.5” Touch Screen + Dual Extruder + 2 x 300g PLA + 2 x Cradle Me + Shipping (via sea)
$9999
Rapide Lite 200XL Dealer Starter Kit
10 x Rapide Lite 200XL + 10 x 2.8” Touch Screen + 10 x 1kg Material + 10 x Cradle Me + 10 x Nozzle Me + Shipping (via sea)

Where it began…

From a simple sketch, Ethan started work on what would become the first Rapide Lite model, a robust, commercial grade 3D Printer that was affordable and built for the masses.

The original, Rapide Lite was designed for the consumer market and released as Rapide Lite 200 in August 2014, it was an instant hit with design enthusiasts and maker fans around the world. Over 1000 Rapide Lite 200’s have been produced in the last 3 months alone.

Since the successful release of Rapide Lite 200, Ethan and the team have been constantly listening to our user base evaluating and re-thinking how to expand and make the Rapide Lite range of printers more robust, higher resolution and more user friendly.

Rapide Lite 200XL is the result...


What we need...

We have the design of Rapide Lite 200XL completed, the electronics certified, manufacturing in place and ready to go. Now we need to create some tooling for the ARM 32 Bit control board and start production.

We hope to do this with your help. In exchange, we are offering outstanding perks with even more outstanding discounts on the retail pricing.

As a start-up, we feel a real affinity with other new innovators - this is why we want to use this opportunity to get our product to other businesses that can use it as part of their design and development process in the future.

Our Stretch Goals

We have some awesome stretch goals to match our commitment to our contributors and because we are the manufacturer we know what we need to ensure these rewards are possible so the more you support us the more we can reward you.

Risks & Challenges...

We have our own factory in Shenzhen, China and are now one of the leading manufacturers of 3D Printers in the world. We have already successfully produced three models of the Rapide Lite family and delivered to deadline, so we are confident that manufacturing risk is at a minimum.

We are very aware of the challenges involved in delivery, so we hope our experience in delivering Rapide Lite 200 will help us to make sure that your perks arrive on time and in mint condition with this campaign.

What you'll get...

Rapide Lite 200XL will be available in two versions: either as a kit or semi assembled model. Both will include ARM 32 bit control board and 2.8” touch screen, and all will be in silver. If all goes well, and if our crowd funding target goes up, we hope to be able to introduce some exciting additional features. So watch this space for more news!

We appreciate your support - let's make this happen together!

Our Team


FAQ’S

Who is Rapide 3D?

The Rapide 3D team is a dedicated team of Australian & Chinese designers and engineers who believe in bringing the best technology to the world sooner rather than later. We have offices in Perth, Melbourne, Hong Kong, Shenzhen and Guangzhou and our own production facility in Shenzhen, China where the design and development of Rapide 3D will be headquartered.

What is Rapide Lite?

Rapide Lite is the future of Desktop 3D Printing and is as affordable as it is functional. Rapide Lite brings together advanced design and technology that will put rapid prototyping in the hands of many faster and cheaper than possible before.

What makes this campaign unique?

We do this for a living, we design, develop and work to create stunning machines that defy the norm, produce parts that exceed expectation and in the process create opportunities beyond just a machine on a desk.

How Does Rapide Lite Work?

Rapide Lite is essentially a rapid prototyping 3D Printer which uses FDM technology to produce 3D print designs from any .stl file. Rapide Lite can print using Mac, PC or Linux. Using our own X Wing Design Rapide Lite performs way above the level expected of an affordable Desktop 3D Printer. You can also use Rapide Lite stand alone through the LCD Touch Screen / SD Card Interface.

Where Will Rapide Lite Be Produced?

Rapide Lite will be produced in our own production facility in Shenzhen, China. We have already produced over 1000 Rapide Lite 200’s and are well versed in the complexities of production at this level. All development and the production of Rapide 3D Printers, Scanners and other cool products used in 3D design and production will be done at this location.

Why Trust Rapide 3D

Rapide 3D has more than a decade of experience with design and development of advanced technology. We have worked with technological integration and development with our partners in China and around the world and are at the cutting edge of 3D Printing technology and design.

We have completed the first 1000 Rapide Lite 200’s and successfully delivered more than 500 printers to our contributors from the Rapide Lite 200 campaign over the past 3 months. We now see expanding our range as a necessary step for continued growth of our company.

We have the ability to offer a 3D Printer’s that are functional, flexible and beautiful at an affordable price.

The key advantage of contributing to this campaign is you are dealing direct with the manufacturer of the product and a campaign with a proven track record for completion and fulfillment. We designed Rapide Lite and will build Rapide Lite in our own factory, there are no 3rd Parties involved which means we can offer Rapide Lite at substantial savings to our foundation contributors.

When Will My Rapide Lite 200XL Arrive?

We are already in full manufacturing for Rapide Lite 200 & 350 and have the capacity to produce 100 printers per day. Scaling production to include Rapide Lite 200XL requires very little change and we see no obstacles to complete this change.

We feel comfortable targeting mid – end April 2015 for the first full batch of Rapide Lite 200XL shipments for our Early Birds contributors, and May - June for other contributors.

At this stage we have a target production of 500 units for the first month and 1000 units per month there after with a total factory production target of 3000 per month across our model range.

How Big Is Radipe Lite 200XL?

Rapide Lite 200XL is 367 x 367 x 650mm which gives it the smallest foot print of any large build volume 3D Printers in the world. Rapide Lite 200XL weighs 13.5kg


What Are The Technical Specifications of Radipe Lite 200XL?

The full technical specifications for Rapide Lite 200XL can be found here

What Is The Retail Price of Rapide Lite 200XL?

We have set our retail price at $2499 for Rapide Lite 200XL with single extruder. Our Indiegogo supporters are definitely receiving special treatment for believing in what we do!

What Filament Does Rapide 3D Recommend?

We have worked closely with Polymakr to optimize Rapide Lite 200XL to work at its best with their excellent range of filament. We will include with all printers 2 x 300g spools of filament, PloyPlus PLA and PolyMax PLA which is are both excellent materials.

Who Are Polymakr?

Polymakr is an international team that focuses on developing new materials for 3D printing. Their goal is to continuously provide the 3D printing community with the best and the most innovative printing materials in the marketplace.

The Polymakr team has a diverse spectrum of expertise and experience, and all have one thing in common: they are all passionate about 3D printing and believe in its world-changing potential. They want to be part of the 3D printing revolution and make our own contributions.

Rapide 3D has chosen to partner with Polymakr because we believe they offer the best quality material at an affordable pricing to match our range of 3D Printers.

What Is The Build Speed? Will The Printer and Parts Last?

Rapide Lite 200XL offers print speeds of up to 150mm per second and the build speed is comparable to other high resolution printers. It does vary depending on the type of print. A typical printing rate is around 30mm of height per hour. However, we are designing Rapide Lite 200XL to be a serious workhorse.

Rapide Lite 200XL has less moving parts than many high resolution printers, and we have been running the prototypes in our office pretty much all day, every day during months of development.

How Many Parts Can I Print With 1kg of Material?

Depending on your printing output and part size, 1kg of material can go a long way.  Our large vase, for example, which is 380mm high and has a circumference of 190mm uses 249gms. You could theoretically print 4 vases with 1kg of material making the production cost less than $7.50 each!

What Are The Material Properties of The Filament?

Our materials are made from bio materials which is good fro the environment and good for you.  We have worked tireless to fine producers of filament who develop consistent quality with the key focus on strength and durability.

Does Our Filament Need to Be Handled Carefully?

Our filament is safe to handle and will not produce any dangerous fumes when printing.

Can You Use Third Party Materials / Filament With Rapide Lite 200XL?

Rapide 3D has a very simple and open policy with our products, we build them for the masses to ensure they have the choice on how they print, where they print and what they print.   We encourage our users to use any filament they feel is suitable for their needs and do not require our printers are used with our filament or that of a 3rd party we recommend.

What Is The Build Speed? Will The Printer and Parts Last?

Rapide Lite 200XL offers print speeds of up to 150mm per second and the build speed is comparable to other high resolution printers. It does vary depending on the type of print.   A typical printing rate is around 30mm of height per hour. However, we are designing Rapide Lite 200XL to be a serious workhorse.

Rapide Lite 200XL has less moving parts than many high resolution printers, and we have been running the prototypes in our office pretty much all day, every day during months of development.

Will Rapide 3D Offer a Warranty or Support?

Rapide Lite 200XL will come with a 3 month limited warranty out of the box. At this stage support will be a big priority and we will be offering support via email initially with the intention to expand this to live chat with remote access capabilities in the future.

However, this will be dependent on reaching our funding goal for this feature as it will be costly to offer this level of support. We know it’s very important and are working on it as a high priority. We’ll guarantee that you receive a working printer, and are planning to take extra special care of those of you who have supported us from the beginning.

Do You Have Plans To Make a Bigger Printer?

The Rapide Lite Family includes the 200, 200XL, 350 and 500 model printers. We have designed Rapide Lite to be scalable and to incorporate a dual extruder in the future. We also have a very exciting vision for the future, which will include a printer that can print both sugar and chocolate!

What Is The Cost Of Shipping?

Shipping prices vary by location and country. If you live in one of the countries listed below shipping is free. If your country is not listed we will be happy to let you know what additional shipping is required for you if you contribute to the campaign. 

All import costs including taxes, duties and customs clearances are the responsibility of the contributor.   We are unable to determine the cost of taxes on each perk for every country prior to shipping as these are different from country to country.   If you are unsure of the impact of taxes on your contribution we advise you contact your local customs for advice.

People living in countries outside our free list will be very aware of the cost of international shipping to their country already so it will not come as a surprise shipping is not free in their case.

What countries get free shipping?

Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, USA, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, New Zealand, Hong Kong, China, UK, Ireland, Spain and Greece.


I Have More Questions. Who Do I Ask?

email us at lite@rapide-3d.com

Rapide 3D has a very simple and open policy with our products, we build them for the masses to ensure they have the choice on how they print, where they print and what they print.   We encourage our users to use any filament they feel is suitable for their needs and do not require our printers are used with our filament or that of a 3rd party we recommend. What Is The Build Speed? Will The Printer and Parts Last? Rapide Lite 200XL offers print speeds of up to 150mm per second and the build speed is comparable to other high resolution printers.  It does vary depending on the type of print.   A typical printing rate is around 30mm of height per hour.  However, we are designing Rapide Lite 200XL to be a serious workhorse.   Rapide Lite 200XL has less moving parts than many high resolution printers, and we have been running the prototypes in our office pretty much all day, every day during months of development.  Will Rapide 3D Offer a Warranty or Support? Rapide Lite 200XL will come with a 3 month limited warranty out of the box. At this stage support will be a big priority and we will be offering support via email initially with the intention to expand this to live chat with remote access capabilities in the future.   However, this will be dependent on reaching our funding goal for this feature as it will be costly to offer this level of support.  We know it’s very important and are working on it as a high priority.  We’ll guarantee that you receive a working printer, and are planning to take extra special care of those of you who have supported us from the beginning.  Do You Have Plans To Make a Bigger Printer? The Rapide Lite Family includes the 200, 200XL, 350 and 500 model printers.  We have designed Rapide Lite to be scalable and to incorporate a dual extruder in the future.  We also have a very exciting vision for the future, which will include a printer that can print both sugar and chocolate! What Is The Cost Of Shipping? Shipping prices vary by location and country.   If you live in one of the countries listed below shipping is free.   If your country is not listed we will be happy to let you know what additional shipping is required for you if you contribute to the campaign. 
All import costs including taxes, duties and customs clearances are the responsibility of the contributor.   We are unable to determine the cost of taxes on each perk for every country prior to shipping as these are different from country to country.   If you are unsure of the impact of taxes on your contribution we advise you contact your local customs for advice.  People living in countries outside our free list will be very aware of the cost of international shipping to their country already so it will not come as a surprise shipping is not free in their case.  What countries get free shipping? Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, USA, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, New Zealand, Hong Kong, China, UK, Ireland, Spain and Greece.   I Have More Questions. Who Do I Ask? email us at lite@rapide-3d.com

story:
Welcome to the PayCase product launch page! What is PayCase you ask, and why do I need it? Before I go into detail with that, let me explain a little about the technology that goes into PayCase.

http://www.rfid-nfc.eu/what-is-nfc

    PayCase is built around a technology called NFC or Near Field Communications. NFC is a form of RFID or Radio Frequency ID and is not a new technology, in fact chances are you have several RFID chips on you right now! RFID has been used as a security measure for everything from access cards for Government agencies and apartment buildings to rapid pairing of smart devices through Bluetooth and WiFi. The thing is, these chips are not near as “Secure” as they claim to be. Check this news clip out.

http://www.news9.com/story/22277092/thieves-using-high-tech-device-to-steal-credit-card-information?autoStart=true&topVideoCatNo=default&clipId=8888965

     Do I have your attention yet? So with companies pouring billions of dollars into expanding touch-less NFC pay-points, how do we protect ourselves when banks are putting these chips into our credit and debit cards more often then not? Go back to using just cash? Or even worse, checks? Do we go with evolution or skip to revolution?

http://bgr.com/2011/08/29/verizon-t-mobile-and-at-prepare-mobile-payment-battle-with-google/ 

    We put science and ingenuity on our side with the simple yet revolutionary PayCase.

    PayCase is a case, form fitted for your mobile phone (Currently available for the iPhone 4/4s/5/5s and Samsung Galaxy S3/S4), that allows you all the convenience of using your bank cards with a fraction of the risk. PayCase protects your information in the most simple way possible, physically. PayCase does this by incorporating a radio wave blocking material into the casing around the NFC chip. The advantage to this approach is that unless you have your phone in your hand and depressing the button, no radio waves can pass through therefore eliminating the risk of virtual pick-pocketers.

    As simple as it works, it is just as simple to activate. When you purchase PayCase in a retail location there will be serial numbers printed on the inner edge of the case. With these unique serial numbers you can go online to a secure site such as PayPal or Google wallet and link the serial number with your bank card. So when you go to pay at a NFC capable POS station the serial number will be transmitted to the correct payment processing site and your bank card will be charged. If your case is lost or stolen you can easily unlink your case with your cards from any internet connected computer or smart device. Even if someone manages to get something in before you unlink, your banks fraud protection will still protect you AND you will still have your physical card to get you by until you purchase a new PayCase.

In our world of high tech gadgetry, social networks, fashion, instant sharing and online shopping you have to be vigilant with your privacy  and looks, and PayCase aims to please on both fronts. Initially PayCase will be offered in two models, the 2S and 4S (referring to the amount of NFC chips built in), each with one pocket for a Government issued ID and available in three colors (black, white and pink).

     The technical specs are done, a prototype has been made, and we have a local Colorado manufacturer ready to produce, all we need is enough to meet the minimum purchase order of $25,000. I have raised some money already but I need YOU to put this over the top! Be ready for revolution support PayCase today! 

PAYPAL PREFERRED

Thank You, Steven Marques.

story:
This is RedBox by 73

About to change everything for everyone, everywhere!

Innovation - Creation - Design - Divergent Thinking  - Technology 

The most portable and multipurpose UPS system ever conceived!

Introducing the personal uninterruptible power supply by 73. Designed to be the core of your PUPS needs. The RedBox Series of Continuous UPS’s is a 21st century concept appropriately conceived at the start of the new millennium.

RedBox by 73 is a small, portable and sleek UPS system of stackable PUPS. Whether it is a backup power system for business, to keep essential services running until the power comes back on. A small dust and splash resistant portable power pack for trekking and camping or a short stack for RV requirements, RedBox by 73 will have an option to suit. If you are an online gaming enthusiast, RedBox G73 will ensure you don’t DC due to power spikes or outages. RedBox E73 emergency power supply is there for when the power goes out and the lights go off to keep you safe, with glow in the dark decals and inbuilt LED's, it will bring back the light and supply emergency power to keep you connected.

Take it wherever you want: 

RedBox Series is completely portable, from the living room to the patio and beyond. 

We are raising funding for the continuing development and manufacturing costs.

RedBox B73: Is a continuous UPS conceived with Business requirements in mind. A Continuous uninterrupted power supply ensuring that when the power goes out, RedBox B73 will keep you up and running until the power comes back on. 

  • A stylish and robust unit, gloss black casing with red trim.

RedBox E73: Is an Emergency Power Supply (EPS) for Home safety. A Continuous uninterrupted power supply ensuring that when the power goes out, RedBox E73 will help keep you and your family connected until the power comes back on.

  • A robust casing with safety red finish and glow in the dark trim.
  • A row of LED’s (lamp) run along the left side top with the on/off non-flush switch on the left side of the unit (front end). 
  • Non-slip silicon grip from mid-way on the top right, wrapping to mid underside for the length of the unit.

RedBox G73: Is a continuous gaming UPS conceived with online gamer's in mind. A Continuous uninterrupted power supply ensuring that when the power goes out, RedBox G73 will keep you up and gaming until the power comes back on.

  • A sleek and stylish concept red with black trim combined with 73’s hard core gaming symbol on the top.

RedBox G73 Black:  Is Black Collector’s Edition. The same continuous gaming UPS conceived with online gamer's in mind,

  • The same sleek and stylish unit in concept black with red trim combined with 73’s hard core gaming symbol on the top.

RedBox RV73: A continuous portable uninterruptible power supply (PUPS) for your RV/Recreational and trekking needs. 

  • A robust casing with red finish and glow in the dark trim.
  • A row of LED’s (lamp) run along the left side top with the on/off non-flush switch on the left side of the unit (front end).
  • Non-slip silicon grip encasing the whole unit.
  • Dust and splash resistant.
All units will include:
  • Blue LED Power and Bluetooth buttons on the front panel.
  • Bluetooth Connectivity to connect to your smartphone and devices enabling features that will allow you to program how your RedBox and the stack behave.
  • Two USB ports on the front panel and two ports on the rear for mobile charging requirements. 
  • Three flush, double pole, automatic switching, three pin sockets in the rear panel. International sockets available.
  • Stackable/inter-connectable with all other units of the RedBox by 73 Series. 
  • 73 & RedBox #73 labels on the from panel. 
  • Every unit has RedBox by 73 genuine microdot security on the inside of the casing and on rear panel. These microdots contain the names of the campaign perk contributors.

E73a Prototype Model: 

 

E73b Prototype Model:

 

B73a Concept Designs:

                       Single unit                                                       Triple Stack      

Personal Uninterrupted Power Supplies are no longer a pipe dream, they are becoming a reality. Can you afford not to be a part of 73's RedBox Series? 

It's only just out of reach!

minutes. UNTIL! The power comes back on.
And we need
additional funding to complete the development and produce the final product.
We need your help to raise $5,000 so that we can make the RedBox
Series a reality. Your contribution will help fund development and
manufacturing costs, including:

Additional Funding
Software development
Bluetooth and Mobile Application development
Application/Controller program interface

Ready for Market






Where will the funds go?

Goal
1 - $5,000 Hack out the new E73a Prototype. Emergency PUPS for Home Safety.

Stretch Goals:
Goal
2 - $7,500 - $10,000 Electronics & Mechanical - Real Time Testing. The test cases will be prepared and run on the generic applications.
Goal

Actioned.

Goal

Goal

$100,000 - Move up the release dates by up to 45 days retrospectively.
Why Now? 
The concept of RedBox was conceived in 2000, an idea fit for the 21st century. We know the math is right, we believe we can bring it to reality. It wasn't until now that we have the technology and the need for RedBox by 73 Series. All we need to do now is combine, the concept, the math, 2014 technology and the dream together. 

The Math is Right!The result could change EVERYTHING! for EVERYONE! EVERYWHERE! 

RedBox Series: for BUSINESS (B73), it is emergency power (E73) for HOME SAFETY & SECURITY, for TREKKING, RECREATION and RV use (RV73) and for GAMING (G73) & (G73 The Black)

A Continuous uninterrupted power supply ensuring that when the power goes out, RedBox G73 will keep you up and gaming until the power comes back on.A sleek and stylish concept red with black trim combined with 73’s hard core gaming symbol on the top.RedBox G73 Black:  Is Black Collector’s Edition. The same continuous gaming UPS conceived with online gamer's in mind,The same sleek and stylish unit in concept black with red trim combined with 73’s hard core gaming symbol on the top.RedBox RV73: A continuous portable uninterruptible power supply (PUPS) for your RV/Recreational and trekking needs. 
A robust casing with red finish and glow in the dark trim.
A row of LED’s (lamp) run along the left side top with the on/off non-flush switch on the left side of the unit (front end).
Non-slip silicon grip encasing the whole unit.
Dust and splash resistant.

All units will include:

Blue LED Power and Bluetooth buttons on the front panel.
Bluetooth Connectivity to connect to your smartphone and devices enabling features that will allow you to program how your RedBox and the stack behave.
Two USB ports on the front panel and two ports on the rear for mobile charging requirements. 
Three flush, double pole, automatic switching, three pin sockets in the rear panel. International sockets available.
Stackable/inter-connectable with all other units of the RedBox by 73 Series. 
73 & RedBox #73 labels on the from panel. 
Every unit has RedBox by 73 genuine microdot security on the inside of the casing and on rear panel. These microdots contain the names of the campaign perk contributors.
E73a Prototype Model:  E73b Prototype Model: B73a Concept Designs:                       Single unit                                                       Triple Stack      Personal
Uninterrupted Power Supplies are no longer a pipe dream, they are becoming a
reality. Can you afford not to be a part of 73's RedBox Series? It's only just out of reach! 
How can you help!

Perks! Contribute through a perk.


Other ways you can help!
Follow us on! Facebook and Twitter @RedBox_G73
Spread the word! Your help and support has gotten us this far. Help us take the next step by telling your friends and family. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter so we can make RedBox by 73 a reality!
Referral contest!


One: Refer 10 friends that select either the First in line or Black Collector’s Edition perk and earn a FREE RedBox #73 for yourself.

Two: Refer 15 friends that select either the First in line or Black RedBox G73 Collector’s Edition perk and earn a FREE RedBox G73 Black Collector’s Edition for yourself.

Three: Refer 5 friends that select A MICRODOT with YOURNAME on it perk and earn a FREE A MICRODOT with YOURNAME on it for yourself.

Simply click on the link [Share this project] below the campaign's main video to copy the link and share it with your friends. The copied link keeps track of your sharing results in contributions. It not only helps us meet our target, but mean we can reward you.
We want to hear from you!  Any suggestions to help us improve would be highly appreciated. Send your ideas on how we can make RedBox by 73 even better to suggestions@73.net.au
*RedBox by 73 T Shirt: Any suggestions that we adopt will earn you a RedBox T Shirt. So get going and send those ideas to suggestions@73.net.au 
                     RedBox by 73                                       RedBox by 1001001


The Risks and challenges:

The next steps are for the continuation of development, the manufacture for the fulfillment of a 14 year dream. we know that before production begins, we may encounter some problems. We have contingency plans in place to mitigate the risks and we have enlisted great advisors to supply solutions.
Software:
The software and app are still in development and we have work to do building the features that we need to include in the RedBox_G73 app. Software development sometimes gets tricky and takes longer than expected, but we have experienced project management and if necessary will look for additional assistance to solve and issues that could emerge.
Manufacturing:
We will undoubtedly have some surprises on our journey, but we have faith in the team and the wisdom to overcome all challengers. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you and deliver it right on time!
We have a plan:




                              Help make it happen! 


                                  for RedBox by 73 Series, and the team @ 73!

Keys: The # symbol is in place of B, E, G or RV the series of RedBox. *Disclaimer (Posted on December 3rd, 2014) Delivery of rewards/perks (i.e. A MICRODOT with YOURNAME on it, First in line, One Fifth Closer or HALL OF FAME) including RedBox #73 and RedBox T Shirts including gifts are subject to the best efforts and are not guaranteed. This is to set reasonable expectations for our contributors/funders.

story:
Hello world:

Welcome to my indiegogo page.  My name is Joseph Sambriski and I am seeking funding for "DeviceRak", my patent-pending product.  I have tested the prototype model that you see in the pictures and video and am ready to have it manufactured.

Production plan:  

The purpose of the funds is to assist in covering the cost of fabricating a plastic injection mould so that the DeviceRak can be manufactured cost effectively.

Currently I have a manufacturer here in New York so if the funding goal is not met I can still have the DeviceRak made at a higher cost per unit. 

What is the DeviceRak? 

The DeviceRak is a convenient way to store your devices while they charge and/or when not in use.  I have tried to find an inexpensive yet quality way to charge my iPhone and my iPod Touch and found that there is no product on the market made to hold more than one device.

Most of the time we all leave our device on a nightstand, a table, or kitchen countertop while charging it which takes up space and has the possibility of being knocked to the floor or having something spilled on it and getting damaged.  Others leave their devices on the floor near the outlet but why risk having it getting stepped on or kicked.

The DeviceRak fits 2 devices; namely the iPhone, iPad, iPad mini, iPod Touch, Nook, Kindle, Droid, Samsung & Blackberry phones, etc.

How does it work?  

The 3M Command strips are adhered to the back of the DeviceRak so just peel and press to the wall. There are no tools needed for installation and the DeviceRak can easily be removed without damage to the wall and used in another location.

A little about me:  

I am a former assistant golf teaching professional and I lost my job in 2009 due to a bad economy.  I started my own company when I came up with an educational math board game called Diceathon which is selling to schools across the country.  I am now focusing on this new project which I know will succeed with your help.
